commune.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a group of people who live together and who share the work and their possessions
commune.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the smallest unit of local government in countries such as France and Belgium
commune.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a group of people in a Communist country who work as a team on a farm, and give what they produce to the state
commune.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a group of people who live and work together and share what they produce
commune.translation[2].definitions[1].de: a group of people who work together on a farm owned by the state, and give what they produce to the state
commune.translation[2].definitions[2].de: the smallest division of local government in countries such as France and Belgium
commune.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: The Auvergne is divided into four Departments which are organised into Cantons and ultimately consist of 1,308 Communes.
